channel.title: Pimpscape Cleaned
channel.description:
Hello, my name is Wavemaker. (Yes stupid name, lets get over it.) Today I am releasing my Pimpscape Cleaned server. Now you may be asking yourself "Why is this BK working on old school servers?" Well one day I decided to clean/stabilize a old school server in order to make it usable again. However, I did not get to process, and implementing a better combat system. I think that this server could have a lot more potential.
Features: Event Manager Crash - Patched Single Threaded More Handlers Constants Fixed Beards
Credits: Graham - Removing Thread per Client, Event Manager - 23% Blake - Crash-Patch - 26% Xero - Original Creator - 39% Me - Adding Handlers, Fixing, Making more user friendly - 22%
[COLOR=RED][B]Old 'Client.java' File size = 836kb New 'Client.java' File size = 668kb[/B][/COLOR]
Pictures: [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/15qqef4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/1z7nfm.png[/img] [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2ic9tz7.png[/img] [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/azi7q0.png[/img]
Things you could work on: I started on ActionButton Handler. I was also going to add a Command handler. I never did touch the process, so that could be a thing to work on. (Convert process to events.)
http://www.mediafire.com/?ey7h7upekh0d20p <--Link [COLOR=RED]NOTE: Does not save, only way to get it saving again is: a) remove single thread. b) add the saving correctly to IOClient. I will try to fix this, but if I fail than I will remove it and add another way for anti-syi.[/COLOR]

item.title: Pimpscape Cleaned
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Dude. Please, don’t release something where the features don’t actually work (E.g Saving + Loading). It is a nice idea etc. BUT! You haven’t actually really achieved anything. You say this is cleaned but it is practically untouched. I bet I could do better given one evening (I am kind of tempted to)

Also, when you handle packets do it via an array and a class for each file. It is much quicker and looks better. Also packaging is a must. (Doesn’t have to be the hard packaging merely putting files into folders and organising)

Constants is a very important class and I don’t know why more servers don’t have it.

Overall: Good start. But finish it next time before releasing.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimpscape Cleaned
item.dc:creator: @recker450 recker450
item.description:
@recker450 wrote:

you should package it, since v2 will have so many files
EDIT:
saw some codes

public void DragonLongSpecial(){ hitDiff = 10 + playerMaxHit; //Hit dif inCombat(); //In combat staticAnimation(248, absX, absY, 100); //Animation setAnimation(1058); //emote actionTimer = 25; //Timer to reset animation teleportToX = absX; // not to move teleportToY = absY; //not to move xD }
more lines but no process use of actiontimer
public void DragonLongSpecial(){ EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent( new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { hitDiff = 10 + playerMaxHit; inCombat(); staticAnimation(248, absX, absY, 100); setAnimation(1058); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; c.stop(); } }, 25000); // executes after 2,000 ms = 2 seconds };

and you should edit the nonwild method else you’re going to keep adding more coords of safe spots

Read full topic

item.title: Pimpscape Cleaned
item.dc:creator: @wavemaker wavemaker
item.description:
@wavemaker wrote:

_James_scape:

is it anti null/syi?

Yes.

Single Threaded: Provides Anti-Null, Anti-SYI and allows the server to be a lot more stable.

Crash-Patched: The Crash Patch fixes a notorious server crash that most winterlove servers suffer from, the patch fixes it.

Event Manager: Instead of using process and have everything run every 500ms when you click an object, you just use events and it calls the event when needed not every 500ms in process.

Constants: This is kind of a user-friendly server class, what you can do in here is pretty much everything. You change your server name in here, you set walk/run/attack/death/block animations, & put announcements up.

That is enough information for everyone to understand I would imagine.

Read full topic
